meanings.definition: Vanguardists: members of a group at the forefront of new developments or ideas
meanings.sent1: The vanguardists in the science club always come up with innovative projects.
meanings.sent2: The vanguardists in the art community inspire others with their creativity.
meanings.sent3: The vanguardists in the book club were so ahead of their time, they started a trend of reading futuristic novels.
meanings.sent4: She was like a vanguardist in the world of fashion, always setting new trends.
meanings.sent5: The vanguardists in the technology field revolutionized the way we communicate.

meanings.definition: Vanguardists: those who lead the way in a movement or cause
meanings.sent1: The vanguardists of the environmental movement organized a successful protest.
meanings.sent2: She was one of the vanguardists who fought for equal rights for all.
meanings.sent3: The vanguardists of the bake sale were determined to sell the most cookies.
meanings.sent4: He stood out as a vanguardist in the fight against poverty, always finding new solutions.
meanings.sent5: The vanguardists of the charity event raised more funds than ever before.
